laws.title: Murphy's law
laws.law: Anything that can go wrong will go wrong
laws.description:
Murphy's law is an adage or epigram that is typically stated as: "Anything that can go wrong will go wrong."
In some formulations, it is extended to "Anything that can go wrong will go wrong, and at the worst possible time."

laws.title: Moore's law
laws.law: Exponential growth is at the heart of the rapid increase of computing capabilities.
laws.description:
Moore's law is the observation that the number of transistors in an integrated circuit (IC) doubles about every two years.
Moore's law is an observation and projection of a historical trend.
Rather than a law of physics, it is an empirical relationship linked to gains from experience in production.

laws.title: Buttered toast phenomenon
laws.description:
The buttered toast phenomenon is an observation that buttered toast tends to land butter-side down after it falls.
It is used as an idiom representing pessimistic outlooks.[1]
Various people have attempted to determine whether there is an actual tendency for bread to fall in this fashion, with varying results.
